question: The nucleus of the functional megaspore divides ______ to form two nuclei.
Two nuclei move to opposite poles forming the ______ embryo sac.
Two more sequential mitotic divisions result in the formation of the ______ stage of the embryo sac.
The 4-nucleate stage later develops into the ______ stage of the embryo sac.
These mitotic divisions are strictly ______ nuclear.
In free nuclear division, nuclear divisions are not followed immediately by ______ formation.
After the 8-nucleate stage, cell walls are laid down leading to the organisation of the typical ______.
Six of the eight nuclei are surrounded by ______.
The remaining two nuclei are called ______ nuclei.
Polar nuclei are situated below the ______ in the large central cell.
Three cells are grouped together at the ______ end and constitute the egg apparatus.
The egg apparatus consists of two synergids and one ______.
Synergids have special thickenings at the micropylar tip called ______ apparatus.
The filiform apparatus plays an important role in guiding the pollen tubes into the ______.
Three cells at the chalazal end are called the ______.
The large central cell has two ______ nuclei.
A typical angiosperm embryo sac at maturity is ______-nucleate.
A typical angiosperm embryo sac at maturity is ______-celled.
Male gametes in flowering plants are produced in the ______ grain.
Female gametes in flowering plants are produced in the ______ sac.
Both male and female gametes in flowering plants are ______-motile.
Pollination is the mechanism to bring ______ together for fertilisation.
Transfer of pollen grains to the stigma of a pistil is termed ______.
Pollen grains are shed from the ______.
Flowering plants make use of ______ agents to achieve pollination.
